item.title: Clear Kayak Tour of Shell Key Preserve and Tampa Bay Area
item.description: Get out on the water and see Tampa Bay from a new perspective with this kayaking tour. Ride in a clear kayak—which has the advantage of greater visibility of the underwater world. Along the way look out for coastal birds, marine life, and the beautiful mangroves. No need to worry about missing out on photo opportunities—the trip includes photo stops and a break at Shell Key to enjoy its beach and sandbars.

image.alt: Clear Kayak Tour of Shell Key Preserve and Tampa Bay Area

item.title: Small Group 2 Hour Dolphin Cruise with Snorkeling to Shell Key
item.description: Look for dolphins around Boca Ciega Bay in St. Pete Beach on a cruise in the Tampa Bay Area. Continue into the Gulf of Mexico to visit Shell Key island, a wildlife preserve where you can snorkel, swim, or collect shells on the beach. Depending on the season, you might spot dolphins, manatees, rays, and a variety of seabirds. This family-friendly tour offers both a late morning and afternoon departure, making it easy to suit your schedule.

image.alt: Small Group 2 Hour Dolphin Cruise with Snorkeling to Shell Key

item.title: Island Sunset and Skyway Light Show - 3hr Boat Cruise in St. Pete
item.description: See a sunset you’ll never forget on board a sightseeing cruise. Sit back, relax, and sail along the Shell Key Preserve with a crew to take you to some great dolphin-spotting areas. Stop at Outback Key with a drink in your hand to watch the sun hit the horizon and look for seashells. On your way back, catch the light show at Skyway Bridge.

image.alt: Island Sunset and Skyway Light Show - 3hr Boat Cruise in St. Pete

item.title: St. Petersburg Jungle Prada Site History Tour
item.description: The state of Florida has a history of human habitation stretching back at least 14000 years. Take a guided tour of the Jungle Prada Site in St. Petersburg to uncover Native American history as you walk through an archaeological site of the Tocobaga tribe. Learn about the ancient peoples and the Spanish conquistadors that landed in the area in 1528 and enjoy time roaming around the lush property.

image.alt: St. Petersburg Jungle Prada Site History Tour

item.title: St Petersburg Speed Boat Adventure
item.description: Experience the thrill of driving a speedboat across the crystal blue waters of Tampa Bay on this sightseeing tour. Hop on board an F-13 mini speedboat and get ready for adventure. Follow a trained guide in a separate boat with a two-way communication system installed to talk back and forth. Check out the beautiful Florida coast and look for pods of dolphins and other wildlife swimming below or gliding down and around from above.

image.alt: St Petersburg Speed Boat Adventure

item.title: Dolphin Quest - Sightseeing/Eco Cruise, John's Pass, Madeira Beach, FL
item.description: Climb aboard a boat for a dolphin quest cruise in Madeira Beach with this sightseeing tour. Explore the waters of Boca Ciega Bay and keep an eye out for playful bottlenose dolphins. Admire views of the beautiful homes on Treasure Island as you cruise through intercoastal waters. Drinks and snacks are available for purchase on board.

image.alt: Dolphin Quest - Sightseeing/Eco Cruise, John's Pass, Madeira Beach, FL

item.title: Semi-Private 2Hr. Sunset Cruise of St. Pete Beach
item.description: Take a relaxed sunset cruise launching from St. Pete Beach and view a different side of the city on this shared small group boat ride. Although it’s shared, the passenger count is kept low to create a semi-intimate experience as you cruise through residential canals to view local mansions. As you pass by Tierra Verde, you might see dolphins swimming near your boat. Bottled water is provided, as well as blankets in the cooler months.

image.alt: Semi-Private 2Hr. Sunset Cruise of St. Pete Beach

item.title: Sunset Cruise over the Gulf of Mexico
item.description: If you're looking for a place to watch the sun set over Florida's stunning water, but don't want to just sit dockside, this Gulf of Mexico Sunset Cruise from Madeira Beach takes you out on the water to do just that. Bring your own alcohol (or non-alcoholic drinks) and enjoy the sunset over the Gulf of Mexico.

image.alt: Sunset Cruise over the Gulf of Mexico

item.title: Shell Key Clear Kayak Sunset & Glow Tours
item.description: Take a unique spin on a regular kayak tour with this Shell Key Preserve Glow-in-the-Dark Kayak Tour from Tierra Verde that lets you explore the water in a clear kayak with LED lights. You’ll get basic paddling instructions, and then hit the water to search for crustaceans, fish, sharks, birds, and more wildlife from the area.

image.alt: Shell Key Clear Kayak Sunset & Glow Tours

item.title: Dolphin Shelling Snorkeling Cruise in Tampa
item.description: Shell Key Preserve is only accessible by water, and if you don’t own a boat, it can be hard to get to the area to explore it. This Shell Key Preserve Snorkeling Cruise from Tampa takes you to the 1,800-acre (728-hectare) wildlife preserve to snorkel and look for shells and wildlife. Some of the wildlife you may see along your journey, includes dolphins, birds, manatees, hermits crabs, fish, and horseshoe crabs.

image.alt: Dolphin Shelling Snorkeling Cruise in Tampa

item.title: Dolphin Watching Nature Cruise and Eco Tour from Hubbard's Marina in John's Pass
item.description: Get out on the water and look for dolphins and other wildlife with this nature boat cruise. Make your way to Madeira Beach to board “The Big Blue Boat,” the largest and most stable dolphin watching boat in the Tampa Bay area, then cruise out in search of dolphins, manatees, sea birds, and more, with full narration along the way.

image.alt: Dolphin Watching Nature Cruise and Eco Tour from Hubbard's Marina in John's Pass

item.title: 4-Hour St. Pete Pier to Egmont Key Experience by Ferry
item.description: The Egmont Key National Wildlife Refuge is a serene, secluded island in Tampa Bay that’s popular for hiking and fishing. Go beyond the beauty of St. Pete’s Beaches and visit this island on a relaxing half-day tour. Sail from the St. Pete Pier over to Egmont Key and spend a few hours wandering miles of white sand beaches. Bottled water is available but you can bring your own food and drink to enjoy a quiet island lunch.

image.alt: 4-Hour St. Pete Pier to Egmont Key Experience by Ferry

item.title: St. Pete Beach Dolphin Racer Speedboat Adventure
item.description: Speed past beaches, skylines, and wildlife on this Dolphin Racer Speedboat Adventure from St. Pete. Take in the views and keep an eye out for bottlenose dolphins that are known to reside in the area. Listen to informative commentary from your guide throughout the ride and enjoy the scenery as you zip around. This short tour easily fits into most schedules and is ideal for families with children.

image.alt: St. Pete Beach Dolphin Racer Speedboat Adventure

item.title: Shell Key Ferry from Ft. DeSoto Boat Ramp in Tierra Verde, FL
item.description: Visit the pristine barrier island of Shell Key to bask on its soft sand, swim in the warm water, and collect countless shells with this ferry from Tierra Verde. Set off directly from the Ft. DeSoto Boat Ramp for the 20-minute cruise to Shell Key, keeping watch for dolphins, sea turtles, and manatees along the way. Relax on the quiet island far from the crowds before the return ferry trip to the mainland.

image.alt: Shell Key Ferry from Ft. DeSoto Boat Ramp in Tierra Verde, FL

item.title: Half Day Fishing Experience from John's Pass in Madeira Beach, FL - 5 Hours
item.description: The deep waters off John’s Pass are an angler’s dream, but without a boat or insider knowledge it can be tricky to find the best fishing spots. This family-friendly fishing trip is the perfect solution. You can also hire the gear and have a local restaurant prepare your fish after the trip (own cost), so you can enjoy all the fishing fun without any of the mess or the stress.

image.alt: Half Day Fishing Experience from John's Pass in Madeira Beach, FL - 5 Hours

item.title: Suncoast Sailing's Sunset Sailing Experience!
item.description: If you’re looking for a romantic experience, dinners can be overrated and not very exciting. This Treasure Island Sunset Sailing Experience is a great thing for couples to do, as well as anyone looking to relax. You’ll take in sunset views as you sail, and bottled water and soda are provided. If you’d like to bring your own drinks, you also can. Plus, a restroom is on board for convenience as you sail.

image.alt: Suncoast Sailing's Sunset Sailing Experience!

item.title: Escape Room Experience - SCORCHED (Approx 1 hour)
item.description: Heat up your day with the Scorched escape room experience in downtown St. Petersburg. You and your group will have one hour to solve puzzles, decipher clues, and escape this room designed by Outerlife Studios. Immerse yourself in the story of a young boy exiled to his room, featuring special effects, props, and unique designs that’ll challenge you to solve the mystery before time runs out.

image.alt: Escape Room Experience - SCORCHED (Approx 1 hour)

item.title: Pirate Adventure Cruise - John's Pass, Madeira Beach, FL - Free Beer and Wine!
item.description: Get out on the water with the whole family on the Royal Conquest Pirate Ship. Cruise out from Madeira Beach for a family-friendly sightseeing and adventure pirate adventure cruise. Onboard, children can enjoy face painting, costumes, water fights, and other activities and entertainment, while adults can enjoy the open bar.

image.alt: Pirate Adventure Cruise - John's Pass, Madeira Beach, FL - Free Beer and Wine!

item.title: 2-Hour Sunset Cruise Tour in St. Petersburg
item.description: Florida’s Gulf Coast offers amazing sunsets each night and locals will tell you that one of the best ways to view it is right from the water. Head down to the St. Pete Pier and join this cruise that offers an impressive sunset showcase. Sail to the Sunshine Skyway Bridge, an impressive structure that’s also a fantastic backdrop for photographs. View the sunset from beneath the bridge then venture back to land for an evening in St. Pete.

image.alt: 2-Hour Sunset Cruise Tour in St. Petersburg

item.title: Kayak Adventure of Shell Key Preserve & Island with a Local
item.description: Paddle through mangrove tunnels, spot dolphins and manatees, and enjoy free time for a swim or shell collecting on Shell Key Island with this unique Shell Key Preserve kayak excursion, led by a local insider. Paddle through shallow saltwater to discover top kayaking spots rich with native Floridian wildlife, and marvel at the area’s natural beauty. Plus, learn about its history and ecosystem along the way.

image.alt: Kayak Adventure of Shell Key Preserve & Island with a Local

item.title: Saint Petersburg Historic Segway Tour
item.description: Experience Florida's St Petersburg like never before on this entertaining 2-hour small-group guided Segway tour. Learn about the Sunshine City’s historic sites and Victorian homes on a loop around the city. See where the world’s first commercial flight took off from and hear about the history of the area’s former Tocobaga tribe, whose princess inspired the Disney story of Pocahontas. Guided Segway training, helmet and safety equipment, plus bottled water and an audio headset are included. This small-group tour is limited to seven people, ensuring personalized attention.

image.alt: Saint Petersburg Historic Segway Tour

item.title: Escape Room Experience - DISARM (Approx 1 hour)
item.description: Take a break from the beaches of St. Petersburg and grab your friends for a thrilling escape room experience. You and your group have been trapped in a room inside an old, poorly maintained building. You have just sixty minutes to try to detonate the bomb and escape the room, solving a series of puzzles, riddles, and challenges.

image.alt: Escape Room Experience - DISARM (Approx 1 hour)

item.title: Three Hour Shelling Cruise to Shell Key Preserve from John's Pass
item.description:
Our 3hr Shell Key Shelling Trip is offered from Hubbard’s Marina inside Johns Pass and offers around one hour on the island exploring and shelling with around an hour ride down the back protected bay waters on a relaxing, safe, and fun trip onboard the HUB Cat 49.
On the ride back to Johns Pass, we will cruise up our beautiful gulf beaches when weather allows, if it’s a little bumpy the ride back will also be in the back protected bay waters.
We will often spot dolphins, seabirds, manatees and other wildlife on the ride out and back!

image.alt: Three Hour Shelling Cruise to Shell Key Preserve from John's Pass

item.title: Saint Petersburg Eco Segway Tour
item.description: Experience St. Petersburg, Florida like never before on this educational and entertaining guided, small-group Segway nature tour. Learn about the Sunshine City’s nature and wildlife on a loop around the Tampa Bay seawall. See manatees and dolphins in their natural habitat. Visit the Sunken Gardens, a botanical paradise and St. Petersburg's oldest living museum and more. Guided Segway training, helmet and safety equipment, and bottled water are included. Dress in weather-appropriate clothes with flat, closed-toed shoes.

image.alt: Saint Petersburg Eco Segway Tour
